re-assigning to core for comment. The runnable specifies a null scheduling 
rule, and does not modify resources (only modifies markers).

You can't run most workspace operations during resource change notification, and
this includes IWorkspace.run. This is not related to scheduling rules, it is a
restriction that has always existed. We have a long-standing request for this to
be changed (bug 29624), but it is quite difficult to support. In your case, if
you are modifying markers in any way, then it certainly can't happen during
resource change notification, because those changes would then cause a
subsequent resource change notification.

Fixed. Changes in JavaDebugOptions manager (and externalized strings). The 
problem initialization is now done in a job with a scheduling rule for marker 
creation on the workspace root.

Please verify, Luc.

NOTE: it is possible that the job will be delayed is the workspace is locked, 
which means we might miss suspending on a quick exception or compilation error 
when debugging. However, it should only be temporary, and is better than 
before since the options will be initialized properly for subsequent launches.

removed the scheduling rule for marker modifiation on workspace root. Marker 
creation generates the rule for us already.
